channel.title: Single vs Dual core processors
channel.description:
Hey i was juss wondering if some of you can help me on one of the 5 assignments i got due this week.. i wont tell you to do everything for me all i was hopin was that you could get couple sites with info. dats all i need from u guys everything else i will manage to doo i am only askin for your guys help is because im getting to much fuckin work this week test presentations and enough assignments :( thankss alott everyone
Single and Dual core processors. - How do they work ? - What are the characteristics of each and what is the difference between them? - What is the best / most optimized environment for them to perform in?

item.title: Single vs Dual core processors
item.dc:creator: @chrisn2323 chrisn2323
item.description:
@chrisn2323 wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Multi-core processor

A multi-core processor is a single computing component with two or more independent processing units called cores, which read and execute program instructions. The instructions are ordinary CPU instructions (such as add, move data, and branch) but the single processor can run multiple instructions on separate cores at the same time, increasing overall speed for programs amenable to parallel computing. Manufacturers typically integrate the cores onto a single integrated circuit die (known as A mul...

Read full topic
